sentences.cn: 参加国际比赛的苏格兰橄榄球队队员

sentences.en: Australia's rugby union side enjoyed a record-breaking win over France.
sentences.cn: 澳大利亚的英式橄榄球联盟队创纪录地赢了法国队。

sentences.en: He has the physique of a rugby player.
sentences.cn: 他有橄榄球运动员的体格。

sentences.en: He rugby tackled her and stole her bag.
sentences.cn: 他将她撂倒，抢走了她的包。

sentences.en: He said they should have the same rights to display their sexuality as straight men who 'play rugby, drink beer and talk about girls with their mates'.
sentences.cn: 他说，这些人应该与那些玩橄榄球、喝啤酒并与伙伴们一起谈论女孩儿的非同性恋者一样，有同样的权利去表达他们的性取向。

sentences.en: He was rugby tackled by a policeman after breaking through police lines.
sentences.cn: 他在突破警戒线后被一名警察拦截了。

sentences.en: His audience consists predominantly of groups of rugby-club revellers.
sentences.cn: 他的观众主要是橄榄球俱乐部里那些纵酒作乐的人。

sentences.en: I ghosted his weekly rugby column for the Telegraph.
sentences.cn: 我为他代写《电讯报》每周的橄榄球专栏。

sentences.en: In Rugby League, Australia trounced France by sixty points to four.
sentences.cn: 在联盟橄榄球赛上，澳大利亚队以60：4的比分大胜法国队。

sentences.en: Lining a corridor is a wall of photographs spanning his rugby days.
sentences.cn: 走廊的一面墙上贴满了他橄榄球生涯里各个时期的照片。

sentences.en: Rugby's a rough game at the best of times.
sentences.cn: 即使是在比赛最不激烈的时候，橄榄球也是一种粗野的运动。

sentences.en: Some speakers argued that boxing was less dangerous than rugby.
sentences.cn: 一些发言者认为拳击的危险性比橄榄球运动小。

sentences.en: The players can advertise baked beans, but not rugby boots.
sentences.cn: 球员可以给烤菜豆做广告，但不能代言橄榄球靴。

sentences.en: The team has accustomed itself to the pace of first division rugby.
sentences.cn: 球队适应了英式橄榄球甲级联赛的节奏。

sentences.en: There were mixed fortunes for French rugby teams on tour.
sentences.cn: 参加巡回比赛的法国橄榄球队成绩有喜有悲。

sentences.en: They have played an expansive style of rugby.
sentences.cn: 他们采用向外展开打法打了一场橄榄球。

sentences.en: U8 is the least of all group, but they all worked hard, and never be late, it is obvious to see their deep love to rugby.
sentences.cn: U8的人数是所有组里面最少的，但是他们都十分努力从来不迟到。他们对橄榄球深深地热爱是显而易见的。

sentences.en: Weber took up the game at Iowa State University, in 1967, after becoming involved in the antiwar movement—in those days, rugby was a countercultural statement.
sentences.cn: 1967年，韦伯在参加反战运动后，在衣阿华州立大学开始投身于这一运动——在那个年代，玩橄榄球曾经是反主流社会的宣言。

trans.tran_cn: 橄榄球运动，拉格比市（英格兰中部的城市），英式橄榄球
trans.tran_en: an outdoor game played by two teams with an  oval (= egg-shaped )  ball that you kick or carry
